intro: Peucedanum chryseum, commonly known as golden cow parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to central and southern Europe and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces small, oval fruits known as schizocarps, which are dispersed by wind. Peucedanum chryseum is often used in herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
